      Calculates Average Sentiment over the time for the pss with the id provided, timespan defines the ammount of years to evaluate, Param and Values are expected string with filtering values separated by ',' , index are expected to math from both Strings after split.

    • Method Detail

      • calc_TOPreachglobalsentiment

        public void calc_TOPreachglobalsentiment(int timespan,
                                         java.lang.String param,
                                         java.lang.String values,
                                         java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Long> top5)
                                  throws org.json.JSONException
        Calculates the Sentiment for the pss id's present in the arraylist top5, and saves it in the database for faster fetching when requested.

        Timespan specifies ammount of year to calculate, String param and values the filtering wanted, top5 the Arraylist with the id's wanted.

        Parameters:
        timespan - whole number that represent years
        param - Example:[Age,Age,Gender]
        values - Example:[0-30,30-60,Female]
        top5 - ArrayList with id's
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - is case JSON creation fails

      • Topreachglobalsentiment

        public java.lang.String Topreachglobalsentiment()
        Returns the string in the database with the top reach pss global sentiment
        Returns:
        String

      • globalsentiment

        public org.json.JSONArray globalsentiment(int timespan,
                                          java.lang.String param,
                                          java.lang.String values,
                                          java.lang.String output,
                                          long id)
                                   throws org.json.JSONException
        Calculates Sentiment over the time for the pss with the id provided, timespan defines the ammount of years to evaluate, Param and Values are expected string with filtering values separated by ',' , index are expected to math from both Strings after split.
        Parameters:
        timespan - In years and whole numbers only
        param - Example: [Age,Age,Location]
        values - Example:[0-30,30-60,Asia]
        id - PSS id
        output - String with filter information
        Returns:
        JSONArray with all the values requested
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - in case creating a JSON fails

      • getAvgSentiment

        public org.json.JSONArray getAvgSentiment(int timespan,
                                          java.lang.String param,
                                          java.lang.String values,
                                          long id)
                                   throws org.json.JSONException
        Calculates Average Sentiment over the time for the pss with the id provided, timespan defines the ammount of years to evaluate, Param and Values are expected string with filtering values separated by ',' , index are expected to math from both Strings after split.
        Parameters:
        timespan - In years and whole numbers only
        param - Example: [Age,Age,Location]
        values - Example:[0-30,30-60,Asia]
        id - PSS id
        Returns:
        JSONArray with the value requested
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - in case creating a JSON fails

      • getPolarityDistribution

        public org.json.JSONArray getPolarityDistribution(long id,
                                                  java.lang.String param,
                                                  java.lang.String value,
                                                  java.lang.String output)
                                           throws org.json.JSONException
        Calculates Polarity Distribution over the time for the pss with the id provided, Param and Values are expected string with filtering values separated by ',' , index are expected to math from both Strings after split, output is the string that is going to be returned referencing the type of filtering applied.

        Distribution agregates values:

        • 0-20 -> '--'
        • 21-40 -> '-'
        • 41-60 -> '0'
        • 61-80 -> '+'
        • 81-100 -> '++'
        Parameters:
        param - Example: [Age,Age,Location]
        value - Example:[0-30,30-60,Asia]
        id - PSS id
        output - String representing what filtering was applied
        Returns:
        JSONArray with all the values requested
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException - in case creating a JSON fails
